```{r}
library(dplyr)

df <- read.csv("Commidity_dependence.csv")
if(!"mining" %in% colnames(df)) stop("Column 'mining' not found in the CSV file.")

df_ranked <- df %>%
  arrange(desc(mining)) %>%
  mutate(
    rank = row_number(),
    n = n(),  
    bin = ntile(rank, 6), 
    score = 7 - bin  # Convert bin to score: top 1/6 gets 6, bottom 1/6 gets 1
  ) %>%
  select(-rank, -n, -bin)

head(df_ranked)
```

```{r}
cat("- All countries:", overall_avg, "\n")
```

```{r}
df <- read.csv("Commodity_all_countries_ranked.csv")

calculate_stats <- function(data, group_name) {
  stats <- data.frame(
    Min = min(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE),
    Median = median(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE),
    Mean = mean(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE),
    Max = max(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE)
  )
  
  # Find countries with min and max values
  min_country <- data$Country.Name[which.min(data$Share.of.Mining.Export)]
  max_country <- data$Country.Name[which.max(data$Share.of.Mining.Export)]
  
  cat("\nStatistics for", group_name, ":\n")
  print(stats)
  cat("Country with minimum Share.of.Mining.Export:", as.character(min_country), "\n")
  cat("Country with maximum Share.of.Mining.Export:", as.character(max_country), "\n")
  
  return(stats)
}

# 1. Super region countries (Super.Region.Country == 1)
super_region <- df[df$Super.Region.Country == 1 & !is.na(df$Super.Region.Country), ]
super_stats <- calculate_stats(super_region, "Super Region Countries (Super.Region.Country == 1)")

# 2. PRGT eligible countries (PRGT.Eligible == 1)
prgt <- df[df$PRGT.Eligible == 1 & !is.na(df$PRGT.Eligible), ]
prgt_stats <- calculate_stats(prgt, "PRGT Eligible Countries (PRGT.Eligible == 1)")

# 3. All countries
all_stats <- calculate_stats(df, "All Countries")

results <- rbind(
  cbind(Group = "Super Region Countries", super_stats),
  cbind(Group = "PRGT Eligible Countries", prgt_stats),
  cbind(Group = "All Countries", all_stats)
)
cat("\nCombined Results:\n")
print(results)
```

```{r}
df <- read.csv("Commodity_all_countries_ranked.csv")

calculate_stats <- function(data, group_name) {
  stats <- data.frame(
    Min = min(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE),
    Median = median(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE),
    Mean = mean(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE),
    Max = max(data$Share.of.Mining.Export, na.rm = TRUE)
  )
  
  # Find countries with min and max values
  min_country <- data$Country.Name[which.min(data$Share.of.Mining.Export)]
  max_country <- data$Country.Name[which.max(data$Share.of.Mining.Export)]
  
  cat("\nStatistics for", group_name, ":\n")
  print(stats)
  cat("Country with minimum Share.of.Mining.Export:", as.character(min_country), "\n")
  cat("Country with maximum Share.of.Mining.Export:", as.character(max_country), "\n")
  
  return(list(stats = stats, min_country = min_country, max_country = max_country))
}

# 1. Super region countries (Super.Region.Country == 1)
super_region <- df[df$Super.Region.Country == 1 & !is.na(df$Super.Region.Country), ]
super_results <- calculate_stats(super_region, "Super Region Countries (Super.Region.Country == 1)")

# 2. PRGT eligible countries (PRGT.Eligible == 1)
prgt <- df[df$PRGT.Eligible == 1 & !is.na(df$PRGT.Eligible), ]
prgt_results <- calculate_stats(prgt, "PRGT Eligible Countries (PRGT.Eligible == 1)")

# 3. All other countries (not super-region and not PRGT eligible)
other_countries <- df[!(df$Super.Region.Country == 1 | df$PRGT.Eligible == 1) %in% TRUE, ]
other_results <- calculate_stats(other_countries, "Other Countries (not super-region and not PRGT eligible)")

results <- data.frame(
  Group = c("Super Region Countries", 
            "PRGT Eligible Countries", 
            "Other Countries"),
  Min = c(super_results$stats$Min, prgt_results$stats$Min, other_results$stats$Min),
  Median = c(super_results$stats$Median, prgt_results$stats$Median, other_results$stats$Median),
  Mean = c(super_results$stats$Mean, prgt_results$stats$Mean, other_results$stats$Mean),
  Max = c(super_results$stats$Max, prgt_results$stats$Max, other_results$stats$Max),
  Min_Country = c(super_results$min_country, prgt_results$min_country, other_results$min_country),
  Max_Country = c(super_results$max_country, prgt_results$max_country, other_results$max_country)
)

cat("\nCombined Results:\n")
print(results)
write.csv(results, file = "statistics_by_group.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```

```{r}
financial <-read.csv("financial_reports.csv")
variable_order <- c(
  "totalAssets",
  "earningAssets",
  "totalLiab",
  "totalStockholderEquity",
  "retainedEarnings",
  "cash",
  "cashAndEquivalents",
  "totalCurrentLiabilities",
  "netDebt",
  "shortTermDebt",
  "shortLongTermDebt",
  "shortLongTermDebtTotal",
  "propertyPlantEquipment",
  "totalCurrentAssets",
  "longTermInvestments",
  "netTangibleAssets",
  "shortTermInvestments",
  "netReceivables",
  "longTermDebt",
  "inventory",
  "accountsPayable",
  "longTermDebtTotal",
  "nonCurrentLiabilitiesTotal",
  "netInvestedCapital",
  "netIncome",
  "ebitda",
  "interestExpense",
  "interestIncome",
  "netInterestIncome",
  "totalRevenue",
  "totalOperatingExpenses",
  "investments",
  "changeToLiabilities",
  "totalCashflowsFromInvestingActivities",
  "netBorrowings",
  "totalCashFromOperatingActivities",
  "issuanceOfCapitalStock",
  "depreciation",
  "exchangeRateChanges",
  "stockBasedCompensation",
  "freeCashFlow"
)

years_wanted <- c(2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025)

ordered_columns <- c("Ticker", unlist(lapply(variable_order, function(var) {
  paste0(var, "_", years_wanted)
})))

final_columns <- ordered_columns[ordered_columns %in% names(financial)]

financial_filtered <- financial[, final_columns]

financial_filtered <- financial_filtered %>%
  select(Ticker, everything()) %>%
  select(Ticker, order(desc(names(.)[-1])))

write.csv(financial_filtered, file = "financials_filtered.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```
